abstract: Halfway through New York City's Million Trees campaign to make city more sustainable, some residents and supporters are grumbling, worried that saplings will eventually lead to buckling sidewalks, dangling limbs and other future hazards if maintenance money is lacking.
snippet: Halfway through the city’s Million Trees campaign, even supporters worry about dead wood and other future hazards if maintenance money is lacking.
lead_paragraph: Halfway through the city’s Million Trees campaign, even supporters worry about dead wood and other future hazards if maintenance money is lacking.

headline.main: As City Plants Trees, Some Say a Million Are Too Many
headline.print_headline: As City Plants Trees, Some Say a Million Are Too Many
headline.seo: New York Planting One Million Trees, Too Many for Some
